sections.title: Our Commitment to GDPR Compliance
content: Coreway Solution is committed to protecting the privacy and security of personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and other applicable data protection laws.
This page outlines how we comply with GDPR requirements and your rights as a data subject under GDPR.

sections.title: Legal Basis for Processing Personal Data
content: We process personal data only when we have a legal basis to do so. The legal bases we rely on include:

legalBases.description: You have given clear consent for us to process your personal data for a specific purpose
Processing is necessary for a contract we have with you, or because you have asked us to take specific steps before entering into a contract
Processing is necessary for us to comply with the law
Processing is necessary for our legitimate interests or the legitimate interests of a third party, unless your interests and fundamental rights override those interests

sections.title: Your Rights Under GDPR
content: Under GDPR, you have the following rights regarding your personal data:

rights.description: You have the right to request copies of your personal data. We may charge a small fee for this service.
rights.howToExercise: Submit a data access request via email to privacy@corewaysolution.com

rights.description: You have the right to request that we correct any information you believe is inaccurate or complete information you believe is incomplete.
rights.howToExercise: Contact us with the details you wish to update

rights.description: You have the right to request that we erase your personal data, under certain conditions.
rights.howToExercise: Submit a deletion request explaining why you want your data erased

rights.description: You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.
rights.howToExercise: Specify which processing activities you want restricted and why

rights.description: You have the right to request that we transfer the data we have collected to another organization, or directly to you, under certain conditions.
rights.howToExercise: Request your data in a structured, commonly used format

rights.description: You have the right to object to our processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.
rights.howToExercise: State your objection and the specific processing you want stopped

rights.description: Where we rely on consent to process your data, you have the right to withdraw that consent at any time.
rights.howToExercise: Use unsubscribe links or contact us directly

rights.description: You have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority if you believe your data protection rights have been violated.
rights.howToExercise: Contact your local data protection authority

sections.title: How We Protect Your Data
content: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including:

measures: Encrypted storage of sensitive personal data
Regular security assessments and penetration testing
Automated backup and disaster recovery systems
Staff training on data protection and GDPR compliance
Strict access controls and need-to-know principles
Data protection impact assessments for high-risk processing
Regular review and update of security policies
Incident response and breach notification procedures
Data processing agreements with third-party processors

sections.title: Data Retention
content: We retain personal data only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected and to comply with legal obligations.

sections.title: International Data Transfers
content: We may transfer your personal data outside the European Economic Area (EEA). When we do, we ensure appropriate safeguards are in place to protect your data, including:
safeguards: Adequacy decisions by the European Commission
Binding Corporate Rules for intra-group transfers
Explicit consent for specific transfers where appropriate
additionalContent: We conduct transfer impact assessments to ensure the level of protection travels with your data.

sections.title: Data Protection Officer
content: We have appointed a Data Protection Officer (DPO) to oversee our data protection strategy and ensure compliance with GDPR requirements.

responsibilities: Providing advice on data protection matters
Serving as point of contact for data subjects and supervisory authorities

sections.title: Data Breach Notification
content: In the event of a data breach that is likely to result in a risk to your rights and freedoms, we will:
list: Notify the relevant supervisory authority within 72 hours of becoming aware of the breach
Notify affected individuals without undue delay if the breach is likely to result in a high risk
Document all data breaches, including facts, effects, and remedial actions taken
Take immediate steps to mitigate the breach and prevent future occurrences

sections.title: Children's Privacy
content: We do not knowingly process personal data of children under 16 years of age without parental consent. If we become aware that we have collected personal data from a child under 16 without parental consent, we will take steps to delete that information as quickly as possible.
If you believe we have collected data from a child without proper consent, please contact us immediately.

sections.title: Automated Decision-Making and Profiling
content: We do not use automated decision-making or profiling that produces legal effects or similarly significantly affects you.
Any automated processing we conduct is limited to analytics and does not result in decisions that affect your rights or create legal obligations.

sections.title: Exercising Your Rights
content: To exercise any of your GDPR rights, please contact us using the following methods:

contactMethods.note: Include 'GDPR Request' in the subject line

additionalContent: We will respond to your request within one month, though this may be extended by two further months for complex requests. We will inform you of any extension within the first month.

sections.title: Updates to This Policy
content: We may update this GDPR Compliance page from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will notify you of any material changes by posting the updated policy on our website.
The "Last Updated" date at the top of this page indicates when this policy was last revised.
